title: Third victim reportedly dies after Pawtucket ice rink shooting
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Gerald Dorgan, 75, died after being in critical condition from the February 16 Pawtucket ice rink shooting, reports say.
The February 16 shooting at Dennis M. Lynch Arena targeted the Dorgan family, resulting in multiple fatalities.
The shooter, Robert Dorgan, died by suicide after being disarmed by three citizens during the high school hockey game.

title: Cat saved after days stuck in a tree following the blizzard that blanketed Rhode Island
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Matt Lyons climbed 40 to 50 feet to rescue Pixie the cat from a tree in Rhode Island.
Pixie was stranded for nearly two days during a historic blizzard with three feet of snow on the ground.
Attempts to rescue Pixie involved neighbors, but police and animal control were unable to assist.

title: 4 questions facing Bruins as they return from Olympic break
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Boston Bruins to play 25 games over eight weeks after returning from Olympic break with a 32-20-5 record.
Bruins face key issues, including a weak penalty kill and high penalty minutes, as they aim for playoffs.
Potential lineup changes loom with trade deadline approaching, while prospect James Hagens may join the team.

title: Fire erupts at MCI-Norfolk prison, no major injuries reported
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Fire broke out Wednesday at MCI-Norfolk, Massachusetts' largest medium-security prison; extinguished quickly by Norfolk Fire Department.
Three incarcerated individuals treated for smoke inhalation; one staff member hospitalized as a precaution, no major injuries reported.
Extent of fire damage at MCI-Norfolk is under assessment; officials investigating cause of the blaze.

title: Stephen A. Smith endorses Jaylen Brown as an MVP candidate
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Stephen A. Smith endorses Jaylen Brown for NBA MVP, citing his performance despite Jayson Tatum's injury.
Brown is averaging 29.2 points, 7.0 rebounds, and 4.9 assists, leading the Celtics to second place in the East.
Smith argues Brown's MVP case is strong due to limited supporting cast compared to rivals like Nikola Jokic.

title: Harvard professor on leave as college investigates ties to Jeffrey Epstein
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Harvard professor Martin Nowak is on paid leave as the university investigates his ties to Jeffrey Epstein.
Epstein donated $6.5 million to Nowak's Program for Evolutionary Dynamics and visited his Harvard offices over 40 times.
Nowak visited Epstein's island and had ongoing correspondence with him; he denies knowing about Epstein's crimes.

title: Malden educator, basketball coach charged with rape in incident involving high school student, officials say
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Malden educator and coach Scott Marino charged with rape, indecent assault, and selling liquor to a minor.
Marino placed on leave following allegations involving a Malden High School student, occurring outside working hours.
Middlesex District Attorney’s Office overseeing the case; Malden Public Schools declined further comment due to privacy laws.

title: Red Sox’ Wilyer Abreu explains viral broken-bat check swing
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Red Sox outfielder Wilyer Abreu's bat broke during a check swing against the Pirates, going viral on social media.
Abreu speculated the bat's earlier contact felt wrong, but chose not to switch bats despite suspecting it was compromised.
Abreu hit 22 home runs last season but was limited to 115 games due to injury, earning a Golden Glove award.

title: All Mass. customers should have power fully restored by end of Friday night, Eversource says
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Eversource aims to restore power to 160,000 customers in Eastern Mass. by midnight Friday after Monday's blizzard.
121,000 outages were reported on Cape Cod and Martha's Vineyard; 40,000 in Plymouth and New Bedford as of Wednesday.
Eversource brought in crews from Canada, New Hampshire, and Ohio, with workers pulling 18-hour shifts to repair outages.

title: Team USA captain Hilary Knight reacts to Trump’s ‘distasteful’ joke about U.S. women’s hockey team
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Hilary Knight criticized Donald Trump's joke about the U.S. women's hockey team as distasteful.
Both the U.S. men's and women's hockey teams won gold medals at the 2026 Winter Olympics against Canada.
The U.S. women's team declined Trump's invitation to the State of the Union due to prior commitments.
